wikipedia_page.main: Edward Loyden is a footballer who played as a centre forward in the Football League for Blackpool, Chester, Shrewsbury Town, Barnsley and Tranmere Rovers. As a Tranmere player, he is remembered for scoring the goal that defeated Arsenal at Highbury in October 1973.

response: Edward Loyden (3 May 1923 – 27 April 2003), known as Eddie Loyden, was a British Labour politician.

To celebrate the landmark of his 500th appearance for Bristol Rovers, Jarman was handed the captain's armband for a Division Three match against Tranmere Rovers on 13 January 1973. Bristol Rovers won the match 2–0, but the occasion was overshadowed by a serious injury to their goalkeeper Dick Sheppard who was carried off by ambulancemen following a collision with Tranmere's Eddie Loyden during the first half. After this the game became a bad tempered affair with the Rovers players aggrieved that Loyden hadn't been sent off, leading to numerous heavy tackles and confrontations between the two teams. It was later revealed that Sheppard had suffered a depressed fracture of the skull in the game, effectively ending his professional career.Jay & Byrne (1994), pp.235–236
